thread.title: Violent scenes as car set on FIRE in Paris as tensions rise over 'police rape'
thread.title_full: Violent scenes as car set on FIRE in Paris as tensions rise over 'police rape'

title: Violent scenes as car set on FIRE in Paris as tensions rise over 'police rape'
text:
Violent scenes as car set on FIRE in Paris as tensions rise over 'police rape' Violent scenes as car set on FIRE in Paris as tensions rise over 'police rape' PROTESTERS against police violence have set cars alight during a rally in the Paris suburb of Bobigny, after an alleged police rape of a 22-year-old man. PUBLISHED: 21:26,   22:00, Sat, Feb 11, 2017 
The man, identified as Theo, was attacked with a truncheon during what police said was an ID check in the Paris suburb of Aulnay-sous-Bois. 
There are suggestions that it was rape, but some sources say that there is not enough evidence to know if this is the case. 
Some of the campaigners have been carrying banners saying “Justice for Theo”, the name of the victim you was sexually assaulted by a police officer with a truncheon. 
The angry protesters have also taken to social media under #justicefortheo to ensure justice is done in Theo's memory. 
One of the organisers said: “We decided to organise this gathering. The announcement has been running on Twitter, Facebook and Snapchat. It made some noise, it shows how much people can’t stand this situation any more.” GETTY Protesters have torched a car during the violence It shows how much people can’t stand this situation any more Rally organiser 
The unrest follows several nights of violence in Paris and it has revived previous controversies over the relationship between the police and immigrant communities in France’s poor suburbs, where there is often accusations of police discrimination and brutality. 
After a search, Theo was handcuffed and taken to a police car where officers insulted him, spat on him and gave him beatings. Related articles
